title: Environmental Protection Expenditure

list: Data should relate to all sites in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland but excludes the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man.
Exclude overseas branches, subsidiaries and agencies.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

content.description: View the questions before you start the survey (external link)
list: Information should relate to the UK.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.
This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data, please submit by the return date and before the next fortnightly survey is published.

content.description: This is defined as spending incurred by businesses where the primary aim is to reduce environmental pollution caused during normal operations, for example expenditure to:

list: reduce or prevent emissions to air or water
dispose of waste materials
protect land, soil and groundwater
prevent noise and vibration
protect the natural environment

content.description: Include:

list: operating or running costs to external organisations and the business's own 'in-house' environment management and control activities
the purchase price of capital goods, to be recorded for the year in which they were capitalised

content.description: Exclude:

list: depreciation or write-offs and payments of general environmental taxes
VAT
expenditure relating to health and safety
You cannot appeal your selection. Your business was selected to give us a comprehensive view of the UK economy.

This survey collects information relating to activities and spending of industries on measures to reduce various types of environmental impacts. The information you provide contributes to the UK environmental protection measures.

blocks.title: Environmental protection expenditure
blocks.description:
This is defined as spending incurred by businesses where the primary aim is to reduce environmental pollution caused during normal operations, for example, expenditure to:

  • reduce or prevent emissions to air or water
  • dispose of waste materials
  • protect land, soil and groundwater
  • prevent noise and vibration
  • protect the natural environment

Include:

  • operating or running costs to external organisations and the business's own "in-house" environment management and control activities
  • the purchase price of capital goods, to be recorded for the year in which they were capitalised

Exclude:

  • depreciation or write-offs and payments of general environmental taxes
  • VAT
  • expenditure relating to health and safety

questions.title: Are you able to report for the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}?
questions.description: Select "no" if you can only provide figures for part of this period or if you need to provide figures for a different 12 month period.

options.label: Yes, I can report for these dates
options.value: Yes, I can report for these dates

options.label: No, I need to report for a different period
options.value: No, I need to report for a different period

values: Yes, I can report for these dates

questions.title: What dates are you reporting for?
questions.description:
If you can report for a full 12 months, provide dates that end between 6 April 2019 and 5 April 2020.

If you traded for only part of the year, please provide the dates for the period in which you were trading.

blocks.title: External operating expenditure
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about payments to external organisations for environmental protection services.

External operating expenditure are payments made to external organisations for the treatment and/or disposal or investigation of solid waste, waste water, air and other (for example, soil, groundwater, noise or vibrations, nature protection). This does not include any capital expenditure.

questions.title: During the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} pay an external organisation for a service that helped to protect the environment?

content.description: Include:

list: removal of solid wastes, waste water and contaminated soil

content.description: Exclude:

list: environmental permits, for example, sewage discharge permits

questions.title: During the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}, how much did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} pay to external organisations for environmental protection services?

content.description: Include:

list: removal of solid wastes, waste water and contaminated soil

content.description: Exclude:

list: VAT
environmental permits, for example, sewage discharge permits

answers.label: Value of external operating costs
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

questions.title: Of the {{ format_currency(answers['answerd49825a9-3298-438e-9561-78e98472866a'], 'GBP') }}, how much related to the following?
questions.description:
Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

If you had no expenditure enter "0". Do not leave blank.

answers.label: Cost of other
answers.description: For example, soil or groundwater, noise or vibrations, nature protection

blocks.title: In-house operating expenditure
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about in-house expenditure associated with the operation of pollution control or abatement equipment.

"In-house" refers to operating costs of the business's own environment management and control activities.

"Abatement equipment" refers to equipment that is used for the reduction in degree or intensity of pollution.

questions.title: During the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} have any in-house operating costs for environmental protection activities?

content.description: Exclude operating costs paid to external organisations; this should be reported in the previous section, "External Operating Expenditure".

definitions.title: What we mean by "in-house operating costs"

content.description: This refers to the operating or running costs of the business's own environmental management and control activities.
For example:

list: any labour costs for time spent carrying out work to protect the environment
leasing payment for equipment
chemicals

questions.title: During the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}, what was {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s in-house operating costs for all environmental protection facilities and environmental management?

content.description: Exclude operating costs paid to external organisations; this should be reported in the previous section, "External Operating Expenditure".

definitions.title: What we mean by "in-house operating costs"

content.description: This refers to the operating or running costs of the business's own environmental management and control activities.
For example:

leasing payment for equipment
chemicals

blocks.title: Capital expenditure for environmental protection
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about fixed assets purchased for environmental protection purposes, including end-of-pipe equipment, integrated equipment and additional costs of environmentally friendly processes.

Capital expenditure refers to the purchase of fixed assets, which are items used repeatedly to facilitate production or provide services, for more than one year.

questions.title: During the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} have any capital expenditure on end-of-pipe equipment that reduced or cleaned pollution generated by your business activity?

content.description: This refers to equipment used to collect and remove pollutants, such as air emissions, effluents, and solid waste, after their creation.
It also refers to equipment which treats and disposes of pollutants generated by the operating activity of the business.

questions.title: During the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}, what was {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s capital expenditure on end-of-pipe pollution control equipment?

content.description: Include:

list: installation costs
equipment which treats and disposes of pollutants generated by the operating activity of the business

content.description: Exclude:

list: VAT

content.description: This refers to equipment used to collect and remove pollutants, such as air emissions, effluents, and solid waste, after their creation.
It also refers to equipment which treats and disposes of pollutants generated by the operating activity of the business.

questions.title: During the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} have any capital expenditure on integrated equipment which made environmental protection part of the process?
questions.description: Most new integrated processes are more efficient and contribute to reducing pollution and the use of raw materials in some way.

content.description: This relates to new or modified production facilities, which have been designed so that environmental protection is an integral part of the process.
An example of this is the purchase of machinery or equipment that is built into the business’s processes and designed to minimise production waste.

questions.title: During the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}, what was {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s capital expenditure on integrated equipment?
questions.description: Most new integrated processes are more efficient and contribute to reducing pollution and the use of raw materials in some way.

content.description: This relates to new or modified production facilities, which have been designed so that environmental protection is an integral part of the process.
An example of this is the purchase of machinery or equipment that is built into the business’s processes and designed to minimise production waste.

answers.label: Capital expenditure on integrated equipment
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

questions.title: During the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} purchase any integrated equipment specifically for its environmental benefits, even though there may have been a cheaper, less environmentally friendly, alternative available?

definitions.title: What we mean by "specifically for its environmental benefits"

content.description: The value recorded in the previous section may have included expenditure on integrated equipment that, while reducing environmental pollution, was not purchased for its environmental benefits. The aim of this section is to capture the expenditure that specifically relates to the additional cost of environmentally friendly processes.
If the selection is a standard technology and there is no cheaper less environmentally friendly alternative available, no environmental protection expenditure should be reported.

questions.title: During the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}, what was the additional cost for the environmentally friendly integrated equipment compared with the cheaper alternative?

definitions.title: How you might answer this question

content.description: The value of the additional cost will be the difference between what was paid for the integrated equipment, purchased specifically for its environmental benefits, and the cheaper alternative.
It can also include the adaptation of an existing installation or process. The environmental expenditure is then the total purchase cost of the adaptation.
If the selection is a standard technology and there is no cheaper less environmentally friendly alternative available, no environmental protection expenditure should be reported.

answers.label: Cost difference
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.
